result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raymond Neeser

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Raymond Neeser not in court, in custody.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court for Raymond Neeser.  Attorney Dennis Murphy in court on behalf of Alexander James Geocaris for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in Court for scheduling conference. Case is in resolution posture. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Defendant to appear by zoom on the next scheduled court date. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Raymond Neeser in court with Attorney Colleen A Taylor; both appear by video.  Defendant Raymond Neeser in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer B. Young. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 11.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
all conditions of bail remain as previously set.

Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court by video, defendant Raymond Neeser not in court, in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
At the time the bench warrant was issued the defendant was in custody in Dane County.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 2500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Raymond Neeser not in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Defendant Raymond Neeser not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Old Town Bank; Joseph P.; Clarice A.;
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Raymond Neeser in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Raymond Neeser in custody.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Raymond Neeser appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
